description: From Middle English mekely, mekeliche, equivalent to meek +‎ -ly. Compare Old Norse mjúkliga.

adverbs.description: meekly (comparative more meekly, superlative most meekly)

entries.meaning: In a meek manner; quietly and humbly.
examples: When Faith and Love which parted from thee never
Had ripen'd thy just soul to dwell with God,
Meekly thou did'st resign this earthly load
Of Death, call'd Life; which us from Life doth sever.
